p.s: The main purpose of the scene is to show the reactions of the police and the King Lords to StarrsStarr's interview.
Another purpose is to show the injustice of the police and to show the cohesion of the people in the diner, who have all been through something like this.
At first there are used many closeupsclose ups on the family members to show their happiness at the diner just to destroy this atmosphere moments later, when they see the King Lords.
TheyThere is often used a hand held camera to show how emotional the scene is or to show how angry Maverick is when he rushes towards the King Lords by shaking the camera.
All over the scene are used many closeupsclose ups on the Carter family, especially on Maverick to shoshow their reactions to the action and to show how they react.
To underline the cohesion of the people in the diner, the director uses a long shot at the diner to show that all people from the diner are watching and filming the police officers.
There are only black people in the diner, to show that it's the black community, thatsthat sticks together and helps each other.
The scene changes negatively when the King Lords apearappear, which is underlined when the camera switches to outside the diner and the lights change from warm and bright to dark.
So the main purpose of the scene is, to show how police and the King Lords negatively react to StarrsStarr's interview.
In the scene are shown conflicts between the Carter family and both of them.
During the scene the camera is always at the same.
The camera angle is always normal, even when Maverick gets dragged to the ground the camera is on his hightheight.
During the scene there are no voice-overs as they are used often in the movie, to put the attention on the action of the scene.
To sum up you can say that in the given scene are used many camera devices to create an emotional atmosphere with many ups and downs.
The scene is very happy at the beginning but gets negative when Maverick starts to fight with the King Lords.
The atmosphere gets more positive when the police arivesarrives and the King Lords drive away, but the police also treats him bad.
The scene ends positive, because the police officers let Maverick go, because of the cohesion of the people in the diner.
